poem:
Title: From Shadows to Light

In wakeful contemplation we spin,
upon this carousel of life transiently caught,
Flickering images in solitary theatres bought,
Mean girls and masters, spectacle begins.

Harmonies rise from conflict's din,
In the sketch of Fey's comedic thought,
We navigate the landscape fraught,
Finding solace in this temporal skin.

In story's end, all must depart,
Yet in the telling - a new start.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From Mean Girls to Masters of the Air: a complete guide to this week’s entertainment Going out: Cinema Mean GirlsOut nowWould you like us to assign someone to butter your muffin? Tina Fey adapted her insanely quotable 2004 teen comedy into an eminently fetch Broadway musical in 2017, and it’s now come full circle with the musical version getting a sparky film adaptation. Get in loser, we’re going to the cinema. The End We Start". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
